sections.title: Introduction
sections.body: POMIS is a government-backed savings scheme offered by India Post, designed to provide a fixed monthly income through interest payouts on a one-time deposit. It is best suited for conservative investors seeking regular, risk-free income.[^1][^2][^3]

sections.title: How the Scheme Works
sections.body:
- A lump sum amount is deposited for a tenure of 5 years.
- The scheme pays interest (currently **7.4% per annum** as of Q3 2025) monthly, credited to the investor’s post office savings account.
- On maturity, the principal is returned and may be reinvested.[^4][^5][^2][^6]
- Minimum deposit: ₹1,000; Maximum: ₹9 lakh (individual) / ₹15 lakh (joint).
- Premature closure after 1 year is allowed with penalties (2% deduction if closed between 1-3 years, 1% if between 3-5 years).[^5][^6]

sections.title: Eligibility Criteria
sections.body:
- Any **resident individual** (including minors above 10 years through a guardian).
- Joint accounts (up to 3 adults) permitted.
- NRIs and entities (HUFs, trusts, etc.) not eligible.[^7][^8][^9]

sections.title: How to Apply
sections.body:
- Visit any post office branch and fill out the POMIS application form.
- Submit KYC documents (age, ID, address, PAN, photographs).
- Make the deposit via cash/cheque.
- Nomination facility is available.
- In-person application is required; online application is not available.[^10][^11][^3]

sections.title: Important Points to Note
sections.body:
- No tax benefit on principal or interest, and interest is taxable as per income slab.
- No TDS on interest payments.
- Multiple accounts possible, but investment limit applies across all combined accounts.
- Post-maturity, unclaimed funds continue to earn interest at post office savings account rates for up to 2 years.[^6][^3][^5]

sections.title: Useful Links
sections.body:
- Official India Post Savings Schemes: indiapost.gov.in/banking-services/saving
- Centralized Scheme Portal: myscheme.gov.in/schemes/pomis[^1][^4]
